comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Einar Sivard: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5715531679/] Quoting pennylrichardsca: "Planned to cross the Atlantic in his motor lifeboat with his new bride, Signe Holm Sivard, July 1914. He was a naval architect. (They also traveled with a navigator, a wireless operator, and other crew members.)" No Wikipedia article (yet).

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: I'm glad to see the newlyweds alive and smiling after their honeymoon journey.  Or is this before they set out?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Einar Sivard was an engineer employed by the company that built the Lundin Lifeboat. Apparently, he also owned shares in the enterprise.
The "motor lifeboat" appears to be the snazzy version of the Lundin Power Lifeboat. Here they are on the deck (with others), preparing to assault the waves:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5764554621/in/photostream/]
Launching of the Lifeboat at Coney Island:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5765102874/]
And here is the Lundin Power Lifeboat, leaving New York harbor:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5765103332/in/photostream/]
Another photo of the Lundin Lifeboat on its test run:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6035107573/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York Times, July 20, 1914, reports testing of the Lundin Power Life Boat: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F4061EFB385A12...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Another article a few weeks later: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0F17F93A5B13738... makes reference to the lifeboat going to the Battery (in lower Manhattan). I think the "Lundin Lifeboat at Battery" photo was taken there, and the building in the background houses a ferry to Coney Island and Rockaway Beach (two different locations).
